intro: Andersonia depressa var. ciliata, commonly known as the serrated Andersonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences with brightly colored, spurred flowers that bloom in spring. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or container planting. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is a popular choice among gardeners interested in exotic plants.
